description: The body of this response.
properties.name: body

description: The body of this response as a string.
properties.name: body_generated

description: This response's headers.
properties.name: headers

description: The request object.
properties.name: request

description: This response's status code (e.g., 200 for OK). _Drash.Http.Response_ objects use _Status_ and _STATUS_TEXT_ from [https://deno.land/x/http/http_status.ts](https://deno.land/x/http/http_status.ts).
properties.name: status_code

description: Construct an object of this class.
methods.name: constructor

description: Generate a response.
methods.name: generateResponse

description: Get the status message based on the status code.
methods.name: getStatusMessage

description: Returns the status message associated with `this.status_code`. For example, if the response's `status_code` is `200`, then this method will return "OK" as the status message.
Get the full status message based on the status code. This is just the status code and the status message together (e.g., `200 (OK)`, `401 (Unauthorized)`, etc.).
methods.name: getStatusMessageFull

description: Send the response to the client making the request.
methods.name: send

description: Returns the output which is passed to `Drash.Http.Request.respond()`. The output is only returned for unit testing purposes. It is not intended to be used elsewhere as this call is the last call in the request-resource-response lifecycle.
Send the response of a "static asset" to the client making the request.
methods.name: sendStatic

description: This server's list of static paths. HTTP requests to a static path are usually intended to retrieve some type of concrete resource (e.g., a CSS file or a JS file). If an HTTP request is matched to a static path and the resource the HTTP request is trying to get is found, then `Drash.Http.Response` will use its `sendStatic()` method to send the static asset back to the client.
properties.name: static_paths

description: Construct an object of this class.
methods.name: constructor

description: Handle an HTTP request from the Deno server.
methods.name: handleHttpRequest

description: The request object.
params.name: request

description: See _Drash.Http.Response.send()_.
Handle cases when an error is thrown when handling an HTTP request.
methods.name: handleHttpRequestError

description: The request object.
params.name: request

description: The error object.
params.name: error

methods.signature: public handleHttpRequestError(request: DrashHttpRequest, error: any): any

description: See _Drash.Http.Response.send()_.
Handle HTTP requests for the favicon. This method only exists to short-circuit favicon requests--preventing the requests from clogging the logs.
methods.name: handleHttpRequestForFavicon

description: Run the Deno server at the address specified in the configs. This method takes each HTTP request and creates a new and more workable request object and passes it to _Drash.Http.Server.handleHttpRequest()_.
methods.name: async

description: This method just listens for requests at the address you provide in the configs.
Add an HTTP resource to the server which can be retrieved at specific URIs.
Drash defines an HTTP resource according to the [MDN web docs](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Basics_of_HTTP/Identifying_resources_on_the_Web).
methods.name: addHttpResource

description: A child object of the `Drash.Http.Resource` class.
params.name: resourceClass

description: This method just adds `resourceClass` to `this.resources` so it can be used (if matched) during an HTTP request.
Add a static path for serving static assets like CSS files, JS files, PDF files, etc.
methods.name: addStaticPath

description: This method just adds `path` to `this.static_paths` so it can be used (if matched) during an HTTP request.
Get the resource class.
methods.name: getResourceClass

description: The request object.
params.name: request

description: Returns a `Drash.Http.Resource` object if the URL path of the request can be matched to a `Drash.Http.Resource` object's paths.
Returns `undefined` if a `Drash.Http.Resource` object can't be matched.
Is the request for a static path asset?
methods.name: requestIsForStaticPathAsset

description: Returns true if the request is for an asset in a static path.
console.log() something.
methods.name: serverLog
